result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Cases 15CM1104 and 15CM1105 called.  Defendant Darryl D Mire in court, in custody, with attorney Jessica Klein.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Count 1 is dismissed and read into case # 15CM1105.
Plea hearing at 08-31-2015 01:30 pm
Hearing at 09-01-2015 08:30 am
Defendant's requested jury instructions
to allow accused to wear his own clothing during trial
regarding prior convictions
filed by Attorney Klein.

Cases 15CM1104 and 15CM1105 called for a jury status hearing.  Defendant Darryl D Mire in court, in custody, with attorney Jessica Klein.   Melissa Zilavy and Andrea Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Klein advises these matters will be going forward to a jury trial.  Court will hear case # 15CM1105 on 9/1/2015.  15CM1104 will remain on the calendar as a hearing and determine where to proceed with that case at that time.  Court will allow the defendant to wear street clothing for trial.  Court will address the motions in limine the morning of 9/1/2015.
Jury status hearing on August 27, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person on September 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Darryl D Mire in court, in custody, with attorney Jessica Klein.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court addresses the speedy trial demand statues.  60 days would be next week regarding the speedy trial request.  The state will not be prepared to go forward next week. The state did not have notice to a speedy trial notice until last weeks notice on 8/7/2015 by the defendant.  The defendant wishes to have a trial next week.  Court addresses the witnesses each party will have for the jury trial.  Attorney Klein makes statements, allowing the state to have a few weeks to prepare for trial due to the defendants late speedy trial request.  Court grants a continuance by the request of the State, due to the lateness of the speedy trial demand.  Court schedules a jury trial for a sooner date.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
dated August 7, 2015 from Jessica Klein
Hearing on August 11, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person on October 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on October 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Darryl D Mire in court, in custody, with attorney Jessica Klein.   Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Klein makes statements regarding the bail modification request.  Darryl Mire makes statements.  State request the bail remain as set.  Court denies bail modification.  Bail remains as fixed. Attorney Klein moves for a speedy trial.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Attorney Klein.
